caption: Good, but overpriced, food. The waiter was not friendly and somehow said that we couldn’t each pay for their own orders, so we had to workout a logistics where one person paid for an entire bill (over $1,500), and we had to Venmo each other later. No thanks!
I'll return with my coworkers.
Filled me up. Bring your appetite because portions are generous.
Service is always nice even when they have a full house. There was fast, efficient, and courteous service. The place has an awesome atmosphere.
Visited near twelve, it was not full. I had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. It has a good atmosphere.
Service is awesome even when they are busy. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Bring your hunger - portions are filling.
Visited near twelve, it was not full. Prices are fair I would say.
Feels similar to a restaurant in New York I liked.
Great food and atmosphere. Wonderful and professional wait staff. Good prices!
Great place!! Pricey but worth it!!!
As a photographer, this space is gorgeous with great light and the staff was very welcoming.
Great food, overpriced...
Lunch.. initially we thought we're we're in the wrong place, or it was closed.  Don't... walk in check it out it is a diamond in the rough for lunch.

There are no words to describe how perfect this place is. Describing just the environment itself would take hours as the entire location flows together smoothly. The staff were fantastically polite and left me feeling at home. I will forever remember the night spent in this palace of happiness!

The atmosphere and decor here envelopes new guests as the come in from the streets. The service from staff stays with me as the highlight of my experience there. Our server Melissa told us about the different dishes, refolded our napkins whenever one of us left the table, and has a lovely demeanor the whole evening. The first thing we tried was the house bread and butter. The loaf was freshly made and had a decadent soft outer crust and an airy interior. I strongly recommend the bread. Next up I had the potato soup. The dish preparation wowed me. The unique flavor the dish has caught me off guard and I grew accustomed to it. I ordered the 60 day dry aged bison cooked medium rare. Once again the team put a wonderful effort into presentation of the dish. The meat laid out and horseradish and celeriac drew the eye to the wonderful juicy bison. All of this drizzled in two sauces. The main course left me underwhelmed compared to the openers. The taste of the bison didn't strike me the way the bread did and the celeriac had a mouth feel that put me off. I ordered a peanut butter creme brulee for dessert. Once again the presentation hit it out of the park. The taste matches for dessert. It was like eating a peanut butter and jelly with a spoon. My overall impression was good, and the price range being what it is makes it hard to know how often I will return.

The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The portions were the perfect size to enjoy the food but not leave stuffed and uncomfortable. We tried dishes we never would have otherwise ordered or thought we'd like and it was all delicious. The kitchen staff obviously take great pride in what they do and how they present their work. Will be returning.

Came here to celebrate Valentine's day early. We had the ribeye and chicken. A little higher price range, but absolutely delicious.  The bread & tartare starters were also very good. Great service and romantic atmosphere. Would come back for a special evening again!
Great food and cocktails! Service was outstanding and thanks to Peter for being such an awesome Waiter! Truly a professional and helped make the dining experience whole!

Oh My!!! Food is over the top amazing, but more then that, it's an experience!!! The creativity of tastes and textures!!! Our son-in-law Dillion(Jack) Choquette is the Sous Chef and made our night So So Special as did Peter our Waiter!!!

Honestly, I was underwhelmed with this place.  My friend has his birthday at a fancy steak place every year. This year he chose Monarch.  We were sat quickly on arrival, which was excellent. Unfortunately it then took about 10 or 15 minutes for our waiter to take our drink orders. I don't think he had more than 2 tables, so I don't know what the holdup was. He kept my drink filled, but was slow to bring the bill as well... not bad service, but not exceptional. On par with any midlevel restaurant.  I ordered a salad and the striploin. My friend ordered the bone-in 100 day dry aged tomahawk chop which they brought out and explained while also asking that we allow time for it to be cooked... this was a nice touch, and he appreciated the fanfare, after all, it cost $250!  The salad was pretty basic, just some iceberg lettuce with a few squirts of dressing and some tomatoes and pickled onions on top. It was good, but I felt it wasn't anything I couldn't get elsewhere for a lot less. For example, Lazlos has a side salad that blows this one out of the water and costs a lot less.  The striploin came and I was excited. I enjoyed the flavor very much as it was dry aged nicely and cooked perfectly, but it was literally about 4 bites of steak. I guess I expected more for $58... and the sides? They were, as far as I could tell, about 5 pieces of celeriac that had been tossed on a grill for a short time, so it was charred a bit and (I'm not joking) 3 or 4 boiled (or steamed?) celery sticks... like the kind you get with hot wings. I got very little flavor out of these, and wouldn't have eaten them, but I was still quite hungry given the size of the rest of the meal.  I don't know... I hate giving bad reviews, but for a bill over $100 for one person (I had a few beers too) I was expecting a LOT more. 801 Chophouse in the area (where we went last year) was a LOT better, and cost about the same.
Good location. Food is okay but not great. However, it's definitely over priced for what you get.
I mean, it was okay. The service was good, not amazing. We had a salad that was a little different. Probably over-dressed. I just can't give it five.

I went for dinner with my colleague the day after thankgiving, the price on the menu was totally different than what you can see in the reviews or link in google. I had to pay $250 for Wagyu Chops instead of $150. We paid about $450 for three people. Expect the double price what you see in the photo in the reviews that people uploaded.
As a Cali and Texas resident we loved catching up with this hip new American establishment focusing on good food and great culinary craftsmanship.
Great staff lovely food amazing ambiance

From late night cocktails to multi course dinner to glam lunches with colleagues, family, and friends. Their burgers are wild by the way! Every nook and cranny is well curated, art forward art deco extravagance.

Without doubt the best steak in Omaha. Fantastic food, and a great cocktail menu. Dining room is always a little cold, wear sleeves. Also served a great lunch menu, and has quality people watching from the bar.

Tried the chef's tasting and it was delightful. Perfectly portioned courses starting small and growing in complexity and intensity of flavor, but never overwhelming in the balance. The reserve wine list paired exquisitely with the entire selection. Each dish was explained as to the ingredients and some of the special preparation done for it by either the server, or more frequently, by the chef who made the dish. It was an awesome meal, a great experience, and I look forward to going back in the future.

Great physical space and atmosphere inside Monarch, especially for a cocktail at the bar. The food is tremendous, special recognition for the brussel sprouts appetizer which was on the menu at the time of visiting.
Amazing customer service and delicious food. Would recommend for dates, dining out, and celebratory dinner. Cocktails and tomahawk steak were on point. Compliments to the chef!
Outstanding meal enjoyed with great company.

We have gone for dinner and brunch and I can only say nice things.  Our waitstaff has always been the best and the food is great.  They did a phenomenal job renovating this space, the moody colors are really inviting and cozy.  I tell everyone to go to Monarch, it's a very special place.
Best meal I have ever had in Omaha
Great cocktails!

Not impressed with the quality of meat at all.  Literally was not able to chew the “center cut ribeye” and another in my group had the strip steak and had the same experience.  I do not recommend at all!

Highly recommend going on a Saturday at brunch, had the place to ourselves! Love live the decor, food, service and would eat here again in a heart beat!! Best steak in town hands down! We had the rib eye and filet!!
The demi glaze was too salty. Nice atmosphere but pricey. I  had better steak at The Rooster in The Garden in Ft. Pierce,  Florida for about 1/2 the price.

Took 20 min just to get a drink order. We eventually left because we were there for 30 min and the waitress didnt come back to take our order. There were only a few tables in there for brunch. We tried to get our bill our waitress told us it was 3 dollars and left again. I tried to pay at the bar but the guy comped the OJ so that was a plus. Food looked great on yelp wish we could have tried it =/

This is Not a dinner review. I was staying at the Deco Hotel and had breakfast. I believe that the kitchen is the same. The breakfast menu was different and imaginative. I tried most of the breakfast plate offerings during my stay and they were all delicious.

As this was our first visit, the knowledge and verbal presentation displayed by our server while going over the menu immediately elevated my satisfaction of the establishment. Our cocktails were imaginative and exquisite. The bison carpaccio was delicious and had a profile unlike one I have tasted before. Our entrees were cooked, cut, and the presentation were all executed to perfection. I would highly recommend to dine here for any occasion.
Happy hour. 6 dollar cocktails
Such an amazing restaurant. Had guests in from out of town and we all had the Tasting Menu. Loved every course. Bravo, Monarch!

My husband and I celebrated his birthday at Monarch last weekend and had a great time. We liked the location (get a drink beforehand at the “secret” bar next door, the Wicked Rabbit), the server was friendly, and the food was good.  However, for the price we paid (nearly $300 with the 20% tip) we sadly were not wowed, and we really wanted to be!  We are foodies and love doing wine and food tasting menus. When we do those types of meals, we are accustomed to an explanation of what we are eating and drinking and the occasional visit from the chef.  Unfortunately, our server’s idea of explaining the food went something like, “Now this wine is from Spain....I can go check on the name....but anyways, wines from Spain are like my fav because they’re good and they’re cheap!”  And, “So do you guys get the what’s going on here? This is like a New York strip and some carrots my chef found at the market today. Enjoy!” (Then she’d scaddatle like a kid in a candy store lol!).  I mean, we don’t need a dissertation but a few more details when you’re paying $75 (food) and $35 (wine) per person should be a given.  The food was good, it just wasn’t quite up to  par with the other tastings we’ve done in Omaha and Kansas City. We are unsure if we will go back. If we do, we will avoid the chefs wine and food 5 course tasting.

Horrible customer service and and experience!!! It took over an hour for us to get our food after ordering. We order a ribeye steak & the pork shoulder. The ribeye was decent once it came; however, the pork shoulder was so small that if order for a child they would have left still hungry! This was absolutely horrible experience and not worth the time or hard earned money! Mahogany Steakhouse much better food, service and experience!

We just had dinner tonight at Monarch, it was very disappointing. We had the $75 a person Chefs special 5 course dinner The first 3 were good.  But something went wrong with the rest of the meal.  It was like the chef left and no one was quality checking the food going out.  Our pasta that we waited an hour for was so salty we couldn’t eat it.  Then the next course was the  protein  The  steak was good but then the carrots were again so salty we couldn’t eat them. Our hole evening we were waiting on our food that wasn’t very good. It was just a big disappointment for everyone in our party.  From 6:45-10:30. It was not a good dining experience, I’m sorry to say. They did comp our drinks and wine. But when you are ready expecting a really good meal and it’ doesn’t live up to expectations, it’s very disappointing. Very sad.
Nice presentation

I stayed at Hotel Deco and decided to treat myself to breakfast on my way out of town. The restaurant was peaceful and bright in the morning. I ordered the omelette and honestly believe it was the best omelette I’ve ever had. It was truly exceptional. Next time I’m in Omaha, I may make a return trip - completely out of the way - specifically for this. Well done.
Amazing service from Chelsea, stellar food

This was a special occasion visit with my family. We were looking forward to a wonderful meal and we were in no way disappointed. We had the chef's tasting menu. From our wait service (thank you Peter) to the food to the pairings, we were delighted at every turn. Highly recommend a visit!

The food tasted good.  But the service was forgetful and slow.  I mean really slow.  Do not take important clients and key customers here, as our group of 9 were LITERALLY the only people in the restaurant and it took over an hour to get our entrees.  Very dissatisfied with the speed and the service.  Would not recommend.
Loved this place. Not a huge steak person but this place may have changed my mind.
The food was unusual and good. I am happy to have had the one experience eating here. Our meal was not good value for the money.

BEST steak in the country! Bravo to the chef on everything because it was out of this world. Highly recommend getting the Bison appetizer as it is truly an experience of its own. The setting is so romantic & beautiful. We will be making the drive from Wichita, KS back to Omaha again soon just to eat at this place.
Not to miss when in Omaha
An "okay" experience.

For the prices I expected more from the plate presentation. Very pricey yet, portion controlled.  Extensive wine and spirits menu but limited dining menu. Very upscale steak house with beautiful decor

A must visit whenever in Omaha. Actually, a reason TO visit Omaha. Warm and stylish. Fabulous quality. Welcoming and professional hospitality. Great service.  All this in a gorgeous cluster of spaces in the Deco Hotel. Try the lunch steak. Try (and please share!!) the “Donut” dessert. And, lest I forget, the fancy NYC-type cocktails at amazingly low prices. Love. Love. LOVE this place. (As does everyone I have ever brought here...)
Great food, great service. #1

Monarch Prime & Bar had been on my radar for quite some time so I was very much looking forward to Easter brunch. Our food was perfectly executed, I highly recommend the Waygu Benedict. However, I was not impressed by our waiter and service has a way of making or breaking an experience. I asked about specials I had seen posted by the restaurant and received a very short “we only have what you see on the menu” response. I ordered the bottomless mimosa and shouldn’t have since getting a refill was impossible. It felt as though we were an inconvenience to our waiter and he would rather be anywhere else. The rest of the staff that we interacted with were all lovely. The decor and the ambiance of Monarch is fabulous. I will visit again and hope for a better service experience.
Yum !!! All you need to say
Beautiful cozy interior, great staff, the dish I enjoyed was a French/Spanish inspired 4oz pork shoulder- all other dishes were also wonderfully prepared.

The ambiance and customer service is really lacking. We have been there twice and we got the same waiter each time. He only said about 5 words to us the whole time we were there and didnt seem to care to be there. The restaurant was very dark, it seemed like the only light source was coming from our tea lit candle as I could barely read the menu. It looks nothing like the pictures on their website.The food is very overpriced and you get very little for what you pay for. Also, interpreting the menu is very difficult, they word the dishes vaguely and you really dont know what you're ordering until it comes out. I really wanted to like the place but it makes it difficult when the wait staff doesnt even like it. We wanted to order a steak but didnt want to wait half an hour like it states on the menu. We were so disappointed that after two drinks (one beer and glass of wine), one appetizer, and $50 later we decided to just go somewhere else.

We just went for dinner before a show at the Orpheum and it was amazing. We had steak and short ribs, appetizers, and dessert. Everything was excellent. It is at a slower pace but as we allowed for that the timing was great.
Beautiful lounge area, great food and amazing music on Monday nights!
I love the food and atmosphere here!  8 have had the ribeye and meatloaf, recommend both.
Went above and beyond my expectations! Definitely a unique dining experience when it comes to both entrees and cocktail flavors! Servers were attentive and on point with recommendations!
Great little hidden spot
Great music, chefs tasting menu was spot on, wine went well with the food. Couldn't have asked for a better experience, especially in Omaha.
Wagyu beef was amazing!
The cocktails here are amazing and never disappoint. I love the atmosphere and the smoked trout is one of the best dishes in Omaha.
One of the best culinary experiences to be had in Omaha, or anywhere
Great speakeasy with some nice cocktails.

Cool place, good food.  A friend and I came here on a Saturday night because neither of us has been and we were looking for something interesting to try.  I was confused walking in at first because there's a hotel entrance, then you walk through a sitting area, and then you get to the hostess stand. I really liked the decor with the huge walk murals and interesting colors.  My friend and I both knew walking in that we wanted the chef tasting menu. I asked what it included but the waitress said it was a surprise and asked if we had any food allergies just incase. We said we didn't so we went ahead with that.  I really enjoyed the courses but I was a little surprised how small each plate was. Chef tasting menus at other restaurants I've been to have all been more substantial. Another concern was how long we were waiting between some of the courses.  For these two reasons I didn't think it would be right to give 5 stars.  Overall though we thought it was a good experience. The wait staff was great and we really enjoyed the food.
Food was fair, though my wife had issues with her steak being cooked to order. Service seemed a bit out of sorts, but they were also pretty busy.
AMAZING food! AMAZING service!
Great service at the small bar. Fantastic Manhattan, nailed the medium rare on the aged sirloin. I'll be back.

Our 2nd time coming and didn't disappoint! The us a great place for a date, double date or some good conversation with friends. The restaurant side doesn't have a "get as much room as possible feel, so the noise level doesn't get out of hand.

I have been here twice. Both times were a delight. Ordered several courses, experienced an early spring and a winter menu over the course of this year. Absolute perfection. The server was knowledgeable and genuine. Helped take the gentlemen's jackets. Helped me to my seat.  Let's talk about the bathrooms. They're splendid and very private. Immaculate. Over all the atmosphere is delightful, the food is delicious.

An overpriced disappointment.  My husband and I were really looking forward to our Christmas eve date night.  When we arrived we were a bit confused about where to go. The hostess area was actually around a corner so we hung out awkwardly until a server and not the hostess asked us what we needed.  We were quickly seated at after we actually found the hostess. Our table was dark. I'm talking cannot read my menu dark or see the face of my husband dark. I'm sure it was part of the mood, but if I have to use the table candle to read the menu perhaps your definition of mood is off.  More disappointment was to follow. One of the reasons I actually choose the location was because of the 5 course tasting menu. It turns out that there was a special tasting menu as it was Christmas eve which would have been great, but actually only consisted of 4 courses and one was an amuse bouche and another was a dessert.  It would have been nice for the website to have let us know this beforehand as 4 courses is hardly a "tasting" menu. We decided to order from the regular menu. We each ordered a first, a main course and a cocktail. We also ordered a side and bread and butter. Nothing ticks me off more than having to pay for bread and butter at a nice restaurant.  I feel that is one of the things that should be included. So our cocktails arrive and they are pretty disappointing. Don't get me wrong, they were strong, but mine tastes just like tequila and nothing else and my husbands was basically a margarita. Our first courses arrived and they are nothing special, and if being honest a little bland. The bread and butter we had to pay for was served right in the middle of our first course Which made it very hard to really enjoy it warm as we were currently eating something else.  My main course was scallops and this was the most expensively disappointing serving of food I've had in some time. Two of my three scallops had not been cleaned properly and had consider amounts of grit. They were cooked correctly but paired with steamed squash. The dish lacked seasoning and flavor and tasted like baby food. The plating was nice, but it was hard to fully appreciate it as it was so dark I couldn't really tell the color of the food I was eating. My husband's bolognese was just mush. He said he couldn't discern the gnocchi from the sauce most bites and that it was rather unappealing to look at.  Our service was prompt but rather unprofessional and didn't seem overly versed in the actual food. She had to look up simple questions like what was on the tasting menu. My husband complimented her tattoos which prompted a bit to much information about playing a game with her mom about all the locations of her numerous tattoos. At the end of the meal we were so disappointed me left without even looking at the dessert menu. We just wanted to pay the over 300 dollar bill and go. I think my husband's statement as we got back into our car was fitting. We had lunch as a taco shop that day and the food was flavorful, the service impeccable, and the price tag was 9 dollars.  He said that the meal at Monarch was the second most satisfying meal of the day.
Best place to eat in the metro area.
Great place with old school vibe. The staff were charming and the food was phenomenal.
Amazing. Go here for any special event and your guest will be thrilled. Dry aged steak is the way to go.
Great food,  great service,  nice ambiance,
Awesome dining experience and wonderful cocktails!
They made me a vegan 5 course tasting menu, the chef really  knows their way around a vegetable
Very impressed with the presentation!! Got the 21 day aged sirloin with a side of carrots. Enjoyed the s'more dessert to finish off dinner

A bunch of us were in town for the wedding and even though they ran out of their infamous big steak, Peter took care of us and made sure we still had an incredible dinner. He even helped celebrate my birthday! Thank for the amazing dinner! If I’m ever in Omaha again, I’ll be back :)
Great service, amazing specials that melt in your mouth (kale and blue cheese and the potato soup with leet and a marshmallow!) plus good cocktails. What else do you want?
Over the top! Start to finish never missed a beat. Very well done chef! Service amazing!

Overall a very good experience. The atmosphere is very intimate, great for a date with your significant other. The hostesses and servers were very attentive and helpful. I had three of Monarch’s dishes, bleu cheese and kale spread, 10 oz. Wagyu Prime Ribeye, and potato fingerlings. The starter was excellent, typically I don’t partake of Kale but this was a very well balanced dish. The steak was cooked and seasoned very well, I truly enjoyed each bite. The potato fingerlings were a great dish that added a new but welcome dimension to the meal.
Tomahawk was to die for, amazing food, great service, special call out to chef Matt! Would go every day if possible.
The venue looked really nice and the staff made it a fun experience. I hope to attend more events there in the future.

Despite the restaurant being empty at 1130am, the host mentioned that they needed to check for reservations. By 1230pm the restaurant was still sparsely filled. The seasonal cauliflower soup is strangely rather sour. Stay away from the waygu salad, not even close to wagyu. More like Reuben corned beef slices that one might find at Subway. The prime steak and eggs are the only redeeming factor but were possibly a little overcooked. Strangely the red peppers with the steak were rather spicy. Service could be a bit more friendly. All in all, skip for brunch.

My husband and I celebrated our anniversary by fully submerging ourselves into the Hotel Deco experience. It started out with a few bumps: I was ensured multiple times (3) by the receptionist staff that 1) a complimentary bottle of champagne was included when booking the whirlpool suite and 2) a reservation was not required to dine at the Monarch. I mentioned this to both the front desk and in passing to Janelle, a manager of the Monarch. We were informed that neither of these details are accurate. HOWEVER, everyone, especially Janelle, corrected the errors with such grace and generosity! Our meal was divine! The staff was so knowledgeable, receptive and attentive. The atmosphere was great. But really, the star of the show was Janelle. She was amazing. Thanks to her, we had an incredible anniversary experience that we won't soon forget. Yum!

UPDATE: We received an apology via email and invited back by manager a week later on 1 Sep 18.  We had an entirely different experience with excellent food and service that included great drinks, appetizer, entree and dessert.  One of the very few places I would recommend a second chance.  The restaurant was far less busy and the wait staff was much friendlier and accomodating.  We will definitely go back again.  On 25 Aug 18, we were guests at the hotel and made reservations for dinner. It had been a couple months since we had dined here and they modified their menu. Waited 40 minutes for a waiter to take our order and when I ordered the lamb I was told they were out. I then asked if they had gotten rid of the monarch burger since it was not on the menu anymore and was told it was on the lounge menu now and that I could not get it in dining room. Waiter had an obvious negative attitude. Staff made us move after already waiting from the dining room to the lounge (50 feet away) and the waitress there ignored us for another 40 minutes before we left. Almost an hour and a half and no service/food plus all the other restaurants close by were now fully booked. Absolutely terrible service ruined our night in the hotel and plans for a birthday dinner.

Waited 30 minutes for a drink. I’m sorry, I have been in this industry as a bartender and didn’t feel like this was too complicated. Especially considering there were 4 people working. Not worth the $30 it cost for two mediocre cocktails.Also, on my initial order I was told to “pick something else” because they didn’t have enough glassware.

Truly exquisite cusine with exceptional service! I have been to many high end restaurants with great food but the chef here and the details to service are some of the best I have ever experienced! A must try experience!

This place has the best ambience among all the restaurants I've been to in Omaha. They have great service too. I was disappointed by their Tomahawk Chop. According to me, it was not up to my expectations. When we were shown the steak before cooking, it looked like it was 45oz. But, the final edible steak on our plate was I would say the size of 18oz. Leaving the quantity aside, I did not think it tasted great. I've had better tasting bigger steaks in a nice restarestaurant for half the price. Definitely not worth $150. I wouldn't suggest this steak for anyone. I would go back to try other things on their menu however.
Amazing drinks!

Fine dining, craft cocktails, excellent wines, and smores for dessert! The French onion dip started our meal.  We tried four of their offering s for our main course. The buffalo, lamb, pork shoulder and meat loaf we're all expertly perpared. We them paired with broccoli and potato fries. Very interesting dips for the fries. The ladies thought the smores we're too rich but I had no problem finishing them off. I highly recommend Monarch for an intimate dining experience.

Totally disappointed. Went there at 630pm on a Saturday and they were sold out of the Steak I wanted to try - the sole reason I went. I get the little sister of the steak and it was mediocre. I order a glass of Bordeaux to come out with the steak - not only does it not arrive until 10minutes after the steak but they are also out of Bordeaux and give me something totally different. I had to eat my cold steak with a glass of wine which didn’t even make sense for the pairing. This place claims elegance and sophistication and even has the price point to match those claims - it ended up being totally false.
Excellent food and service

The food was really good & very unique. We went for lunch and the servings were a perfect size. Service was great too. We had the potatoe and trout starter as well as the kale and ham starter and they were excellent. For entrees we both got the ageed sirloin and it was delicious.
Delicious tomahawk chop! Great service and yummy drinks!

I would give them 10 stars in could.  The food was amazing and the service was impeccable!  The bison tartare was inspired and delicious.  The Wagyu Tomahawk Chop was the best steak I've ever had, and the potatoes and mushrooms really elevated the whole experience!  Also, not as important, but a special kudos to the music selection in the background; it created a very relaxed, chill atmosphere that wasn't stuffy or pretentious.
Wow!  Great food and service.  Definitely a high end steak house.

I would put this down as very good but not amazing.   Went there for a business dinner with about ten people.   Service overall good but it did seem we were looking for our waiter a few times.   I had a bison steak which was good and cooked properly but didn’t have the taste I was looking for and seemed a little bland.  Others at the table enjoyed their meals a lot
Fabulous dining experience. Definitely for that special occasion.
Excellent food and drinks. Planters punch is great! Highly recommend blue cheese and kale app.

I had the most fabulous meal here!  First trip ever to Omaha and I was told by my friends I had to have steak during my visit.  This restaurant is at the bottom of Hotel Deco where I was staying. I had worked up quite a bit of an appetite after a long day of walking the Old Market and on to the Joslyn Art Museum. My friends weren’t arriving into Omaha from California until later tonite so I thought I’d treat myself to a really nice dinner.  Luckily I got there fairly early and was ushered to a nice seat by the window. The restaurant is 2 levels,  one goes down to a cozy space with a darker atmosphere. I chose to stay at street level where there was more light and I could look out the windows.  I started with a beet salad which was dressed with a light and amazing dressing bad accompanied by ramps and egg yolks. Truly amazing.  Then I had the 21 day aged Wagyu sirloin (medium rare of course!!!). and asparagus with lime and creme fraiche. Totally superb.  Tender yet hearty. Sometimes I feel like having something a bit more robust than filet mignon or prime rib.  The asparagus was just perfect.  They had a snap to them and a lush buttery flavor that were perfect side by side with the steak.  My server - Josh? - OMG I was so taken with everything he suggested and now I’m spacing on his name). Anyway he suggested a full bodied Bordeaux To go with everything.  And he was right!!!  Perfect pairing!  And to top it all off I got the s’mores dessert.  They look like petit fours covered in luscious dark chocolate with crumbled graham crackers on the bottom and candied hazelnuts that had stretched sugar stems that were edible. They almost looked like mini lollipops. And surrounded by whipped marshmallow that was given some browning to remind you of real s’mores getting crisp over an open flame.  Overall,  best total meal I’ve had in a long time!
The tomahawk is a life experience. The ribeye is pretty amazing too. Get the frites! The decor and music just adds to a great atmosphere. My new favorite Omaha steak place
Great service,  subpar food for the price
Great meal and atmosphere.
The food and service were outstanding. Awesome menu.

Service was absolutely top notch! Bar staff was very friendly, with pride in their creations. Wait staff was very knowledgeable to the menu and pairings.  My steak was clearly of high quality, dry aged. I do eat my beef very rare. In this instance it was a bit beyond the temperature I wanted, but not so far that it impacted my enjoyment of dinner.  Definitely a place to visit again. The hotel where Monarch Prime is looks like an amazing place too.

Nice foods, ordered elk ossobuco included bone and small fork for bone marrow but not server with bread. Order bottle of wine and charged $8 corking fee. Not recommended price / value with issues outlined above.

Husband and I went here for Valentine’s Day, they had a special menu just for the day and everything was beyond spectacular! The service was friendly, and informing. The ambience was quiet, elegant, and gorgeous. The food was simply delicious! The portions were perfect, and everything was so well balanced and flavorful. I really appreciate how carefully crafted each dish was, every course was beautifully presented and had unique flavor combinations that were out of this world! We will definitely be back!
Outstanding cuisine. Surprising and delightful taste combinations. Environment is very cool.
Nicely decorated and in the Deco Hotel. Close to downtown theatres.

Six of us had dinner Saturday at Monarch's.  Service was excellent and food was ok.  Not nearly good enough or large enough servings to warrant the price.  Certainly not enough steak in a "steak community" to warrant $40!  Need also to check out the bar--out of several things, martini warm and gin fizz sour.  Will try the Monarch again in a few months to see if improvements have been made.  Otherwise, we are back to the several other nice restaurants in Omaha.
Went for a party style gathering, the food was great. It was buffet finger-style food but it was still worth going for that alone. Good service as well
Portions surprisingly right sized; very tasty dishes with outstanding presentation
I had the best meatloaf, sorry grandma. I suggest the cauliflower appetizer;  45 DAY WAG Y U P R I M E R I B; and their cheesecake!
Chef whipped up a vegan entree that was fantastic.

Monarch Prime & Bar is superb. The menu boasts a plethora of pleasant surprises. A treat to the senses! The delectable drinks, food and stunning interior, alone, are reason enough to want to lounge there all day and night. The service, however, is what really holds you in its graces. All of the staff- from the bar to the dining room-are so accommodating and attentive. Brian Heese, the beverage program manager, is especially welcoming. He is quite knowledgable about every aspect of the operation, which is incredibly comforting and helpful to patrons. His mindful care of customers and warmth won me over as a patron and I'm sure will win over many more to come. Do yourself a favor and check out Monarch. You are sure to become a regular. ;)
Went for a team dinner with an out of town visitor and Monarch didn't disappoint. The ambiance is modern and relaxed. The service is excellent without feeling stuffy. The food was amazing.
